captions.text: Wooohooo! Ahhhoooo!
So, you're just going to run through the forest with your hair dragging all over the place, huh?
I can't believe I did this!!!!
Youre not worried about stuff, I don't know, getting tangled in it?
So fun!! Woo hahahahha!
Oh! There goes a stick!
Theres a stick in your hair!
And some leaves, a lot of leaves. Actually.
Wait, is that a bird's nest?
Eww!
Im never going back!!!
This is getting gross. Now theres mud.
At least I hope that was mud.
Ugh... Was that a dead animal?
You've got a dead animal in your hair!!!
WOOOOOO!!!!
I think it was a squirrel...
You don't even care?
Nothing?
Well, this is unfortunate.
At first I though you were kind of cute and I was having second thoughts about stealing from you, but now i think...
Whahahah!! Woohoo!
This is just sad..
And you might be a little on the crazy side.
Woohoooo!
Mmhmm, the precious...
Ok, this is getting weird. I'm just gonna go.
You take care, Rapunzel.
Best. Day. Ever!!!!
Hahahahhaha!!!
Whew, that was a close one! Glad we moved past that...
No more girls with crazy hair. Oh, hey. How you doin'?
My name is.. OH MY GOSH!!

comments.text:
I feel like part of the magic of the hair was that it didn't get tangled 
and repelled dirt. I mean how else do you explain its length. Any normal 
hair would have split and pulled out by now. She should have some serious 
two tone going on. So the only explanation must be magic, extra strength, 
dirt repelling, untangleable hair.﻿

comments.author: TheAdam1995

comments.text:
+Elana Davis
Here's the jist:

Merida is one of the worst female leads I have ever seen in a film. She may 
not be as bad as Bella Swan or Clary Fray but she is unbearable!

Merida is a whiny, stubborn and irritating brat who acts like a child 
rather than a proper teenager. She is blind to the consequences of not 
getting betrothed and bitches at her mother for only doing her fucking job!
She is so oblivious to the blatant like the fact that her mother could've 
DIED from eating the cake she got from that witch. All she ever cares about 
is changing the laws and doesn't give two shits about anything else. She 
never develops as a character, she never does anything meaningful and she 
is just a pain to watch.
She refuses to grow and mature and at the end of the day just makes Mater 
from Cars look like Mr. Potato Head!

That pathetic excuse for a main character was the big ass nail that shut 
the coffin in an instant.
If that wasn't enough, the story is complete, unoriginal shit, the morals 
are confused and forced and the title of the film is a fucking lie! What 
does this story have to do with being brave?! NOTHING!

Brave is, and shall be, one of the worst animated films ever made. It does 
not deserve any attention or awards in the slightest. All that film did was 
kill my love for Pixar.

Fuck that movie!
comments.author: TheAdam1995

comments.text:

I always wanted to end with Flynn finding out during the festival, while 
Rapunzel is looking that the picture of herself and her parents. For crying 
out loud, the Queen was saved by a magic flower, and Rapunzel's hair glows 
at "Flower Gleam and Glow." and Rapunzel turns the exact same age on the 
exact same day. Too many things that are close to be otherwise.  ﻿
